---
title: GHQ 12 vs SAS
url: "/compare-harmonise-instruments/ghq-12-vs-sas/"
date: 2024-12-10
---

## GHQ 12 vs SAS

Researchers in the field of psychology and social sciences often cross match questionnaires when conducting longitudinal studies. These comparisons are crucial to understand changing social patterns and behaviours. One such comparison that psychologists frequently make is between the General Health Questionnaire (GHQ-12) and the Social Aptitude Scale (SAS). The process of comparing these questionnaires, usually called harmonisation, can be quite laborious and subjective. This is where Harmony, a tool specifically designed for such comparisons, comes in. Harmony utilizes advance natural language processing and generative AI models to automate the harmonisation process. This artificial intelligence tool can fetch a percentage match between each item on GHQ-12 and SAS, significantly reducing the time and effort involved in manual harmonisation. Researchers who wish to use Harmony to compare GHQ 12 and SAS may do so by selecting the instruments from Harmony's database or upload their questionnaire in PDF format onto Harmony's user-friendly web interface. The GHQ 12 vs SAS comparison using Harmony not only supports harmonisation in English but also across multiple languages. With Harmony, comparisons of GHQ 12 and SAS, or any similar instruments, become streamlined, accurate, and swift. Harmony's ability to provide harmonisation of GHQ 12 and SAS, and many other questionnaires, establishes it as an indispensable tool in the field of psychology and social sciences, offering researchers an efficient approach to leverage existing cohort and longitudinal studies.
